conclusion: Plan to analyze the graph to understand the particle's motion and identify moments when speed is 5 m/s.
The graph shows a displacement x versus time t curve starting at x = 10 m at t = 0 s and decreasing linearly to x = -10 m at t = 4 s.
The graph shows a linear decrease in displacement from 10 m to -10 m over 4 s.
The slope of the line represents the velocity of the particle. The slope is constant, indicating a constant acceleration.
The speed of the particle is the absolute value of its velocity. The slope of the line is -5 m/s^2.
The speed at any time t can be calculated using the equation v = at + v_0, where v_0 is the initial velocity.
Since the initial velocity v_0 = 0, the speed at any time t is v = 5t.
The speed is 5 m/s when t = 1 s.
The speed is -5 m/s when t = 3 s.
Therefore, there are two moments when the speed is 5 m/s.
